title: Typophiles with blogs/websites
content: Compiling a list. Please add if you would like to share.
author: Chris Dean

comments.content: [http://typophile.com/node/12012](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019235007/http:/typophile.com/node/12012 "http://typophile.com/node/12012")?

I think Christopher wants to map that list to typophile membership, or maybe include typophile members non-typographic blogs and sites - so my blog [www.obscureghostbustersrealtedjokesandlimericks.com](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019235007/http:/www.obscureghostbustersrealtedjokesandlimericks.com/ "www.obscureghostbustersrealtedjokesandlimericks.com") would count too?

Sorry,

To clarify, I would like member of typophile.com to post their blogs about typography and type related content.

Thanks in advance.

Okay.

My blog: [http://opentype.info](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019235007/http:/opentype.info/ "http://opentype.info")

@ Herrmann: So you know Rutherford?
Of course, we even live in the same street in Weimar.

Here is [the group blog of the MATD ’09 students, in Reading](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019235007/http:/emayteedee.org/), and here is [Dispatches from Reading](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019235007/http:/cavedoni.com/reading/), my own blog on the whole Reading year (until two weeks ago).
[Daily Pangram](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019235007/http:/dailypangram.blogspot.com/).
[By The Font](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019235007/http:/www.bythefont.com/) --- it's nothing important, impressive, or worthwhile, but it's mine.

[Readable Web](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019235007/http:/readableweb.com/)  
New. Covers the upheavals - large and small - of society's move from words in print to words on screen.  
With some jokes mixed in.
@metalfoot: I always thought your avatar is actually a glyph, not an image! It looks so beautifully colorful when enlarged.
Yeah, it's a glyph alright.
